scenarioDescription:
The IC 4651 9122 Exoplanetary System


Overview

IC 4651 9122 is a star with 2.1 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 2802.74 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1.14 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

IC 4651 9122 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the IC 4651 9122 system


IC 4651 9122 b

IC 4651 9122 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2018-12, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of IC 4651 9122 b is 2003.400 times the mass of Earth. The radius of IC 4651 9122 b is 12.700 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, IC 4651 9122 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system IC 4651 9122, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the La Silla Observatory.
name: IC 4651 9122 - System With 1 Exoplanet
